required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Study To Compare The Efficacy And Safety Of 0.3 MG Pegaptanib Sodium To Sham Injections In Subjects With Diabetic Macular Edema
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Controlled, Double-Masked, Multi-Center, Comparative, In Parallel Groups (For 24 Weeks), To Compare The Efficacy And Safety Of 0.3 MG Pegaptanib Sodium, With Sham Injections, And Open Study (For 30 Weeks) To Confirm The Safety Of 0.3 MG Pegaptanib Sodium In Subjects With Diabetic Macular Edema (DME)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study to assess the efficacy of pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg comparing sham injection and to confirm safety of pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg in subjects with diabetic macular edema.

detailed_description.textblock: During the study, an issue was reported concerning proper maintenance of treatment masking (See Result: Limitations and Caveats)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity (VA) in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
primary_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity (VA): Double Masked Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in VA were monitored through refraction and best-corrected VA measurements using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Underwent Focal/Grid Laser, or Vitrectomy: Double Masked Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Included focal laser photocoagulation, grid laser photocoagulation, and vitrectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 54: Open Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity (VA): Open Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in VA were monitored through refraction and best-corrected VA measurements using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Underwent Focal/Grid Laser, or Vitrectomy: Open Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Included focal laser photocoagulation, grid laser photocoagulation, and vitrectomy.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Acuity Over Time at Each Time Point: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Distribution of Change From Baseline of Visual Acuity (VA) at Each Time Point: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected VA measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts. Change from baseline in VA was categorized as follows: Lost 15 letters or more; Lost 10 - 14 letters; Lost 1 - 9 Letters; No change or gained 1 - 9 letters; Gained 10 - 14 letters; Gained 15 letters or more.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥15, ≥5, or ≥0 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exhibiting a Decrease From Baseline in Retinal Thickness at the Center Point by ≥25 Percent and ≥50 Percent Using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: OCT, a noninvasive, noncontact, transpupillary imaging technology, was utilized to image retinal structures in vivo. The anatomic layers within the retina, retinal thickness could be measured.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI-VFQ-25) Composite Score/Sub-scale Score at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
other_outcome.description: NEI-VFQ 25, Japanese version v.1.4 for self-administering questionnaires consisted of the base set of 25 questions and 12 subscale scores. Response categories to each question were converted to a 0 to 100 scale so that the lowest and highest possible scores were set at 0 and 100 points, respectively. A higher score represented better functioning. Questions within each sub-scale were averaged together to create the 12 sub-scale scores. The overall composite score was calculated by averaging the vision-targeted subscale scores excluding the general health-rating question. Positive change indicated improvement.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Acuity Over Time at Each Time Point: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Distribution of Change From Baseline of Visual Acuity (VA) at Each Time Point: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected VA measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts. Change from baseline in VA was categorized as follows: Lost 15 letters or more; Lost 10 - 14 letters; Lost 1 - 9 Letters; No change or gained 1 - 9 letters; Gained 10 - 14 letters; Gained 15 letters or more.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥15, ≥5, or ≥0 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 54: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exhibiting a Decrease From Baseline in Retinal Thickness at the Center Point by ≥25 Percent and ≥50 Percent Using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Week 54: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: Retinal thickness was assessed by spectral-domain optical coherence tomography or OCT3000, a non-invasive imaging technique that uses long-wavelength light to capture micrometer-resolution cross-sectional images from biological tissue.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in The 25-Item National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI-VFQ-25) Composite Score/Sub-scale Score at Week 54: Open Phase
other_outcome.description: NEI-VFQ 25, Japanese version v.1.4 for self-administering questionnaires consisted of the base set of 25 questions and 12 subscale scores. Response categories to each question were converted to a 0 to 100 scale so that the lowest and highest possible scores were set at 0 and 100 points, respectively. A higher score represented better functioning. Questions within each sub-scale were averaged together to create the 12 sub-scale scores. The overall composite score was calculated by averaging the vision-targeted subscale scores excluding the general health-rating question. Positive change indicated improvement.

intervention.description: Intravitreal injection of 0.3 mg every 6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type I, or Type II diabetic subjects
- Subjects must have macular edema that involves the center field of the macula 3. Foveal thickness of at least 250 μm 4. Best corrected distance visual acuity in the study eye must be a letter score between 68 and 35 inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Eyes with prior panretinal photocoagulation (PRP) less than 4 months prior to baseline eyes in which PRP is needed now or is likely to be needed within the next 9 months
- HbA1C level >12% or recent signs of uncontrolled diabetes
- Atrophy/scarring/fibrosis involving the center of the macula, including evidence of laser treated atrophy

facility.name: National Hospital Organization Nagoya Medical Center
Kobe City Medical Center General Hospital
Shiga University of Medical Science Hospital
National Hospital Organization Tokyo Medical Center
Niigata University Medical and Dental Hospital

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24) and 5 times in the open phase (from Week 24 to Week 54).

group.title: Sham in Double Masked, Then Pegaptanib Sodium in Open Phase
group.description: Sham injection was conducted during the double masked phase (up to Week 24) according to the identical procedure of pegaptanib sodium administration, with exceptions of no needle used and no medication. Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks in participants who were originally randomized to Sham and entered in the open phase (Week 24 to Week 54). Total number of injection was 5 times in the open phase.

participants_list.participants: One participant discontinued from the study due to adverse event before study drug administration.
Four participants did not enter to the open phase after completing the double masked phase.

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24) and 5 times in the open phase (from Week 24 to Week 54).

Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks in participants who were originally randomized to Sham and entered in the open phase (Week 24 to Week 54). Total number of injection was 5 times in the open phase.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity (VA) in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
outcome.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24) and 5 times in the open phase (from Week 24 to Week 54).

Total number of injection was 5 times in the open phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥10 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity (VA) in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
measure.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was to assume that there was no difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups. The alternative was to assume that there was difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Significance level of test in the comparison between pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg and sham was set to 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Stratification factors (HbA1c and baseline visual acuity categories)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity (VA): Double Masked Phase
outcome.description: Changes in VA were monitored through refraction and best-corrected VA measurements using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity (VA): Double Masked Phase
measure.description: Changes in VA were monitored through refraction and best-corrected VA measurements using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts
measure.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. analysis.groups_desc: Comparison at Week 6: The null hypothesis was to assume that there was no difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups. The alternative was to assume that there was difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Significance level of test in the comparison between pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg and sham was set to 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Based on an analysis of covariance with treatment as a factor and stratification factors (HbA1c and baseline visual acuity categories) as covariates.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison at Week 12: The null hypothesis was to assume that there was no difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups. The alternative was to assume that there was difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Significance level of test in the comparison between pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg and sham was set to 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Based on an analysis of covariance with treatment as a factor and stratification factors (HbA1c and baseline visual acuity categories) as covariates.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison at Week 18: The null hypothesis was to assume that there was no difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups. The alternative was to assume that there was difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Significance level of test in the comparison between pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg and sham was set to 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Based on an analysis of covariance with treatment as a factor and stratification factors (HbA1c and baseline visual acuity categories) as covariates.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison at Week 24: The null hypothesis was to assume that there was no difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups. The alternative was to assume that there was difference between the pegaptanib sodium and sham injection groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Significance level of test in the comparison between pegaptanib sodium 0.3 mg and sham was set to 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Based on an analysis of covariance with treatment as a factor and stratification factors (HbA1c and baseline visual acuity categories) as covariates.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experience a ≥15, ≥5, or ≥0 Letter Improvement of Visual Acuity in Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Chart From Baseline at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
measure.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exhibiting a Decrease From Baseline in Retinal Thickness at the Center Point by ≥25 Percent and ≥50 Percent Using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
outcome.description: OCT, a noninvasive, noncontact, transpupillary imaging technology, was utilized to image retinal structures in vivo. The anatomic layers within the retina, retinal thickness could be measured.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24) and 5 times in the open phase (from Week 24 to Week 54).

group.title: Sham in Double Masked, Then Pegaptanib Sodium in Open Phase
group.description: Sham injection was conducted during the double masked phase (up to Week 24) according to the identical procedure of pegaptanib sodium administration, with exceptions of no needle used and no medication. Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks in participants who were originally randomized to Sham and entered in the open phase (Week 24 to Week 54). Total number of injection was 5 times in the open phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants Exhibiting a Decrease From Baseline in Retinal Thickness at the Center Point by ≥25 Percent and ≥50 Percent Using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
measure.description: OCT, a noninvasive, noncontact, transpupillary imaging technology, was utilized to image retinal structures in vivo. The anatomic layers within the retina, retinal thickness could be measured.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI-VFQ-25) Composite Score/Sub-scale Score at Week 24: Double Masked Phase
outcome.description: NEI-VFQ 25, Japanese version v.1.4 for self-administering questionnaires consisted of the base set of 25 questions and 12 subscale scores. Response categories to each question were converted to a 0 to 100 scale so that the lowest and highest possible scores were set at 0 and 100 points, respectively. A higher score represented better functioning. Questions within each sub-scale were averaged together to create the 12 sub-scale scores. The overall composite score was calculated by averaging the vision-targeted subscale scores excluding the general health-rating question. Positive change indicated improvement.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 1: participants who received at least 1 injection after randomized to study treatment and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in the double-masked phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

measure.title: Mean Visual Acuity Over Time at Each Time Point: Open Phase
measure.description: Best-corrected visual acuity (VA) measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set 2: participants who received at least 1 injection and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in open phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

outcome.title: Distribution of Change From Baseline of Visual Acuity (VA) at Each Time Point: Open Phase
outcome.description: Best-corrected VA measurements were performed using retro-illuminated, modified Ferris-Bailey ETDRS charts. Change from baseline in VA was categorized as follows: Lost 15 letters or more; Lost 10 – 14 letters; Lost 1 - 9 Letters; No change or gained 1 – 9 letters; Gained 10 – 14 letters; Gained 15 letters or more.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 2: participants who received at least 1 injection and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in open phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exhibiting a Decrease From Baseline in Retinal Thickness at the Center Point by ≥25 Percent and ≥50 Percent Using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Week 54: Open Phase
outcome.description: Retinal thickness was assessed by spectral-domain optical coherence tomography or OCT3000, a non-invasive imaging technique that uses long-wavelength light to capture micrometer-resolution cross-sectional images from biological tissue.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set 2: participants who received at least 1 injection and had VA assessments both at baseline and at least once at post-dose in open phase. Missing values except for baseline value were imputed using a last observation carried forward approach (LOCF).

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium (Baseline to Week 24)
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24).

group.title: Sham (Baseline to Week 24)
group.description: Sham injection was conducted during the double masked phase (up to Week 24) according to the identical procedure of pegaptanib sodium administration, with exceptions of no needle used and no medication.

group.title: Pegaptanib Sodium (Baseline to Week 54)
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks. Total number of injections were 4 times in the double masked phase (up to Week 24) and 5 times in the open phase (from Week 24 to Week 54).

group.title: Sham Conversion (Week 24 to Week 54)
group.description: Pegaptanib sodium 0.3 milligrams were administered as an intravitreous injection every 6 weeks in participants who were originally randomized to Sham and entered in the open phase (Week 24 to Week 54). Total number of injection was 5 times in the open phase.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: During the study, an issue was reported concerning proper maintenance of treatment masking. Due to this masking process issue, the study results cannot be interpreted as that arising from a well-controlled double-masked trial.
